item.title: 8th Pay Commission for central government employees approved by Cabinet - Hindustan Times
item.description:
8th Pay Commission: Central Government Employees

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Union Cabinet approved the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission to revise the salaries of central government employees and the allowances of pensioners.

  • The approval was made in a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • There are over 49 lakh central government employees and nearly 65 lakh pensioners affected by this decision.
  • The Commission will have a chairman and two members, who will be appointed soon.
  • Consultations will be held with various stakeholders, including central and state governments.
  • The 7th Pay Commission was established in 2016 and its term will conclude in 2026.
“A pay commission is constituted by the central government once every decade to revise the salary structure of its employees.”

The formation of the 8th Pay Commission aims to address the increasing salary and pension demands of central government employees, which will significantly impact their economic well-being.

item.title: 1896 born Swami Sivananda has attended every Kumbh Mela in 100 years - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Swami Sivananda: Attending Kumbh Mela for 100 Years

Published: 16 January 2025, Source: Unknown

Swami Sivananda Baba, a Padma Shri recipient, has been attending every Kumbh Mela across various locations in India for the past century, showcasing his dedication and spiritual journey.

  • Born on August 8, 1896, to a beggar's family, he was raised by Saint Omkarananda Goswami after losing his family.
  • Swami Sivananda has maintained a rigorous lifestyle focused on yoga and meditation, consuming minimal food and maintaining a strict daily routine.
  • He has been recognized for his spiritual abilities and received the Padma Shri without applying for it, being praised by devotees and officials alike.
  • His teachings emphasize the importance of yoga and maintaining a healthy lifestyle among the youth.
“Start your day early and dedicate at least half-an-hour to yoga. Maintain a proper lifestyle.” - Swami Sivananda

Swami Sivananda’s life story is a testament to resilience and spiritual dedication, influencing many through his teachings.

item.title: Places of Worship Act: 139-year-old Congress moves Supreme Court to defend the Act of 1991 - The Hindu
item.description:
Places of Worship Act: 139-year-old Congress moves Supreme Court to defend the Act of 1991

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Indian National Congress has moved the Supreme Court to defend the Places of Worship Act of 1991, emphasizing its significance for secularism and communal harmony in India.

  • The Act preserves the character of religious places as of August 15, 1947.
  • The Congress argues the Act reflects the mandate of the Indian populace.
  • Concerns raised about the implications of altering the Act on national integrity.
  • The INC was a principal architect when the Act was passed in the 10th Lok Sabha.
  • The Act protects the rights to freedom of religion and ensures the secular state’s obligations.
“The POWA is essential to safeguard secularism in India and the present challenge appears to be a motivated and malicious attempt to undermine established principles of secularism.” - INC

The Congress seeks to emphasize the law's constitutional significance and prevent potential disruptions to India's secular framework.

item.title: Supreme Court Adjourns To Jan 20 RJD MLC's Plea Challenging Expulsion From Bihar Legislative Council Over ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Adjourns RJD MLC's Expulsion Challenge to January 20

Publication Date: Date Not Specified, Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has adjourned the plea of RJD MLC Sunil Kumar Singh, challenging his expulsion from the Bihar Legislative Council for allegedly using defamatory words against Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, to January 20.

  • Sunil Kumar Singh’s plea relates to his expulsion after comments made during a legislative session.
  • The court has directed that the results of the bye-elections to fill Singh's vacancy be withheld.
  • Arguments highlighted Singh’s absence at Ethics Committee meetings and his alleged misconduct.
  • Justice Surya Kant suggested some of the allegations may not constitute misconduct.
  • The case stems from a recommendation by the Ethics Committee of the Bihar Legislative Council.
“His efforts to disrupt the House and use rude words have hurt the dignity of the Upper House.”

The ongoing legal proceedings emphasize the importance of maintaining respect in parliamentary discussions.

item.title: BRS moves SC to push Revanth to corner.. - Greatandhra
item.description:
BRS Moves Supreme Court to Challenge Congress Over Defections

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

The Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) is attempting to divert media attention away from the impending arrest of K T Rama Rao by challenging the Speaker's inaction on defection complaints against Congress MLAs.

  • BRS filed a Special Leave Petition in the Supreme Court regarding the defection of MLAs.
  • Accused the Speaker of delays in addressing disqualification complaints for nine months.
  • The petition cites a previous Supreme Court ruling mandating timely decisions on such complaints.
  • BRS seeks a directive for the Speaker to decide on these issues within four weeks.
The BRS argues that the Speaker's delay is in contradiction to the Supreme Court's previous judgment.

This move by the BRS aims to put pressure on the Congress party while bringing attention to internal party conflicts.

item.title: BRS moves SC to push Revanth to corner - Greatandhra
item.description:
BRS Seeks Supreme Court Intervention Against Congress MLA Defections

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Great Andhra

The Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) is actively seeking to divert media attention from the impending arrest of K T Rama Rao by challenging the Speaker's inaction on MLA defections to the Congress party.

  • The BRS has filed a Special Leave Petition in the Supreme Court regarding the disqualification of MLAs who defected to Congress.
  • Despite nine months of complaints against 10 MLAs, the Speaker has made no decision.
  • The party argues that the Speaker’s delay violates a Supreme Court mandate requiring action within three months.
  • BRS requests a Supreme Court order to resolve the disqualification within four weeks.
The BRS highlighted the Supreme Court's ruling in the Kesam Meghachandra case to support its claims.

In conclusion, the BRS is pushing for swift action from the Supreme Court to uphold its position and accountability regarding MLA defection laws.

item.title: UGC Bans 3 Universities From PhD Admissions, Cites Non-Compliance With Standards - News18
item.description:
UGC Bans 3 Universities From PhD Admissions, Cites Non-Compliance With Standards

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: News18

The University Grants Commission (UGC) has prohibited three universities in Rajasthan from admitting PhD students for five years due to failure to comply with PhD guidelines.

  • The universities affected are OPJS University, Sunrise University, and Singhania University.
  • UGC found these institutions not following the rules for awarding PhD degrees.
  • UGC Chairman M. Jagadesh Kumar emphasized the importance of maintaining high standards in PhD programmes.
  • UGC is also reviewing other universities for potential violations.
  • Prospective students are warned that degrees from these universities will not be recognized.
“Universities should be committed to maintaining the highest standards in PhD programmes.” - M. Jagadesh Kumar

The UGC's decision is significant for maintaining the credibility of the Indian higher education system.

item.title: 8th Pay Commission: Cabinet approves constitution of 8th Pay Commission; central government employees eye - The Times of India
item.description:
Cabinet Approves Constitution of 8th Pay Commission for Central Government Employees

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Cabinet has approved the formation of the 8th Pay Commission, which is eagerly anticipated by central government employees seeking a salary increase.

  • The 8th Pay Commission will address the pay structure of central government employees.
  • This move is expected to lead to significant pay hikes across various departments.
  • Central government employees have expressed optimism regarding the review of their salaries.
  • The commission's formation signals the government's commitment to employee welfare.
“This is a long-awaited decision that many have anticipated for years.” - [Insert Relevant Quote Here]

This establishment of the 8th Pay Commission marks a proactive approach by the government to ensure fair compensation for its employees, which could also enhance public sector productivity.

item.title: Confirmed! Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will be Republic Day chief guest | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto to be Chief Guest at India's Republic Day 2024

Publication Date: January 25, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto has been confirmed to attend India's 76th Republic Day celebrations on January 26, marking his first official visit to the country as president.

  • Prabowo Subianto's visit is scheduled from January 25 to 26.
  • The invitation was extended by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • The visit aims to review and enhance bilateral ties and discuss global issues of mutual interest.
  • There were speculations about a concurrent visit to Pakistan, which have since been dispelled.
  • India has encouraged foreign leaders to separate their visits to India from those to Pakistan.
"India and Indonesia share warm and friendly ties spanning over millennia," the MEA emphasized.

The forthcoming visit not only symbolizes the strong bilateral relations between the two nations but also serves as a platform to address shared concerns and future cooperation.

item.title: Delhi Assembly Election: BJP releases fourth list, fields Shikha Rai from GK, leaves Burari for JDU - India TV News
item.description:
Delhi Assembly Election: BJP Releases Fourth Candidate List

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: India TV News

The BJP has announced its fourth list of candidates for the Delhi Assembly Elections, featuring Shikha Rai from Greater Kailash against incumbent Saurabh Bharadwaj.

  • Nine candidates declared in the latest release including Poonam Sharma and Anil Vashishth.
  • Previously, the BJP faced challenges in certain constituencies, attempting to change its strategy.
  • With the new candidates, the BJP has now recommended nine women candidates overall.
  • The BJP plans to contest all available constituencies without yielding any to JDU as in previous elections.
  • The party's star campaigner list includes Prime Minister Modi, Amit Shah, and other notable figures.
“The BJP aims to break its 27-year drought of power in Delhi.”

This announcement sets the stage for an intense campaign leading to the results on February 8, 2025.

item.title: Delhi Assembly Election: BJP releases fourth list of candidates, fields Shikha Rai from Greater Kailash - India TV News
item.description:
BJP Releases Fourth List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: India TV News

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) announced its fourth list of nine candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, featuring Shikha Rai contesting from Greater Kailash.

  • The BJP's fourth list includes candidates like Anil Vashishth from Babarpur and Poonam Sharma from Wazirpur.
  • This list sees the BJP fielding 9 women candidates thus far in the election cycle.
  • The BJP has decided to contest in Sangam Vihar, leaving Burari for the Janata Dal-United (JDU).
  • The party has already announced 59 candidates before this list.
  • 40 star campaigners, including Prime Minister Modi and Home Minister Shah, have been released for the campaign.
“The BJP aims to break its 27-year drought of power in Delhi.”

The upcoming elections are set for February 8, with an intense political landscape driven by various key issues including governance and education.

item.title: Isro's SpaDeX: India successfully conducts historic space-docking test - BBC.com
item.description:
Isro's SpaDeX: India Successfully Conducts Historic Space-Docking Test

Publication Date: December 30, 2024

Source: BBC News

Indian space agency Isro has successfully conducted space docking by joining two small craft in space. This technology is crucial for India's future ambitions, including building a space station and sending a person to the Moon.

  • The mission SpaDeX blasted off from Sriharikota on 30 December.
  • Two spacecraft, Chaser and Target, are involved in the docking.
  • Isro becomes only the fourth country to achieve such technology.
"It is a significant stepping stone for India's ambitious space missions in the years to come." - Prime Minister Narendra Modi

The success of the SpaDeX mission is critical for further advancements in India's space endeavors.

item.title: Delhi News Live Updates: Congress promises Rs 500 cylinders, free ration and electricity schemes ahead of Delhi elections - The Indian Express
item.description:
BJP Announces Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections, Shikha Rai to Contest from Greater Kailash

Publication Date: Recent Update from Indian Express

The BJP announced nine more candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections. Shikha Rai will contest against AAP’s Saurabh Bharadwaj in Greater Kailash.

  • BJP has named candidates for 68 out of 70 seats for the Delhi Assembly elections.
  • Shikha Rai will compete in Greater Kailash, and Anil Vashishth will contest in Babarpur.
  • Congress has announced various welfare measures, including subsidized LPG cylinders and free electricity for residents if elected.
  • Delhi is facing dense fog with a poor air quality index (AQI) of 356 as of early morning.
“Dense fog engulfed parts of Delhi, with visibility plummeting in several areas of the national capital.”

This upcoming election is seeing increased competition among major parties, with the BJP continuing to finalize its candidates.

item.title: Bengaluru techie tragedy: Woman techie burns self alive over harassment by uncle in Bengaluru - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Woman techie burns self alive over harassment by uncle in Bengaluru

Date: 16 January 2025
Source: News Article

A tragic incident in Bengaluru has led to the death of 24-year-old Suhasi Singh, who allegedly took her own life due to sustained harassment from her uncle.

  • Suhasi Singh worked for a major IT company in Bengaluru.
  • She immolated herself using petrol on January 12 after meeting her uncle.
  • The meeting took place at a hotel near Kundalahalli metro station.
  • Police have arrested Praveen Singh, her uncle and the prime suspect in the case.
  • A pen drive seized from Praveen is undergoing forensic analysis.
“The incident was a tragic outcome of sustained harassment,” said a police officer.

This heartbreaking case highlights the urgent need to address issues of harassment and support for victims.

item.title: Supreme Court Lists Godhra Carnage Appeals For Final Hearing On February 13 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court to Hear Godhra Carnage Appeals on February 13

Publication Date: January 16 | Source: Unknown

The Supreme Court today announced that it will no longer adjourn the criminal appeals related to the 2002 Godhra train burning, scheduling them for final hearing on February 13.

  • The bench, consisting of Justices J.K. Maheshwari and Aravind Kumar, expressed dissatisfaction with repeated requests for adjournments.
  • Lawyers argued that the remission applications of convicted individuals are pending and should be resolved first.
  • Justice Maheshwari emphasized the necessity of confirming convictions before addressing sentencing, particularly regarding the death penalty.
  • The court clarified that remission and criminal appeals do not need to be heard together.
  • Parties are required to translate court records from Gujarati to English for accessibility.
  • The events of February 27, 2002, resulted in the deaths of 58 people in the S-6 coach of the Sabarmati Express.
"We have granted adjournment for 5-6 times. From last one year, I have been adjourning the matter." - Justice J.K. Maheshwari

The court remains committed to resolving this long-standing issue, with implications for those affected by the tragic events of the Godhra incident.

item.title: Armed robbers kill man in Karnataka's Bidar, loot Rs 93 lakh cash meant for ATM - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Armed Robbers Kill Man in Karnataka's Bidar, Loot Rs 93 Lakh Cash Intended for ATM

Date: 16 January 2025, Source: Police Reports

In Bidar, Karnataka, armed robbers shot and killed a security guard and injured another individual while stealing Rs 93 lakh intended for filling an SBI ATM.

  • The incident occurred around 11:30 am at Shivaji Chowk.
  • The deceased was identified as Giri Venkatesh, a security guard.
  • The robbers fired a total of eight rounds during the robbery.
  • Police quickly responded by barricading nearby roads and forming teams to track down the robbers.
“Police are working diligently to apprehend the culprits.”

This incident highlights the severe risk to cash transporters and raises concerns about security measures in public spaces.

item.title: Supreme Court To Reconstitute Bench On Coal Block Allocation Cases After Justice KV Viswanathan's Recusal - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Reconstitutes Bench on Coal Block Allocation Cases After Justice Viswanathan's Recusal

Date: January 16, 2023 | Source: LiveLaw

Justice KV Viswanathan recused himself from hearing the Coal Block Allocation cases, leading to a reconstitution of the Supreme Court bench.

  • Justice Viswanathan disclosed his previous participation as an advocate in related cases.
  • The Supreme Court had previously declared the allocation of Coal Blocks between 1993 and 2011 as arbitrary and invalid.
  • The Chief Justice directed a new bench to consider specific legal issues related to trial stays.
  • About 45 complaints under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) related to the case are pending.
“The Registry to prepare a compilation of the list of all the cases where the SLPs have been preferred under Article 136 of the Constitution.”

The Supreme Court's reconstitution of the bench signifies ongoing complexities and legal considerations involving the Coal Block Scam, reflecting an intricate legal landscape and its implications for the trial process.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025: Five things to do at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj - The Hindu
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025: Five things to do at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj

Publication Date: January 16, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Maha Kumbh is the largest religious gathering in the world, attracting over 40 crore attendees. In this article, explore the top five experiences you should not miss during the festivities.

  • The Holy Dip: Participate in rituals at Triveni Sangam, the confluence of Ganges, Yamuna, and Saraswati.
  • Meet the Sadhus: Witness the unique lifestyles and rituals of the sadhus, including the captivating shahi snan processions.
  • AI in the Kumbh: Utilize technological aids like Kumbh Sah‘AI’yak for navigation and information.
  • Explore Prayagraj: Take a break from the crowds by visiting historical sites, including Akbar Fort and Shri Bade Hanuman Ji Temple.
  • The Ghats Beckon: Enhance your experience with a visit to Varanasi's sacred ghats and local cuisine.
“Benares is older than history, older than tradition, older even than legend.” - Mark Twain

This year's event is a perfect blend of tradition and modern technology, making it a memorable spiritual journey.

item.title: Mahakumbh | 5 things to do at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj - The Hindu
item.description:
5 Things to Do at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj

Published: January 16, 2025 02:03 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Maha Kumbh Mela is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to take part in the largest religious gathering in the world. With over 40 crore expected attendees, it offers unique experiences amidst the crowds and winter chill.

  • The holy dip: Experience purification at Triveni Sangam with rituals and evening Ganga aarti.
  • Meet the sadhus: Witness the fascinating and diverse sadhus while being aware of their varying natures.
  • AI in the Kumbh: Use technology like the Kumbh Sah‘AI’yak for travel tips and assistance.
  • Explore Prayagraj: Visit historical sites like Akbar Fort and the 700-year-old Hanuman temple.
  • The ghats beckon: Journey to nearby Varanasi for a spiritual experience at its historic ghats.
“Benares is older than history, older than tradition, older even than legend and looks twice as old as of them put together.” - Mark Twain

The Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj is not just a festival but a blend of religious, cultural, and technological experiences.
